data.title: Accidental stumble into history...
data.text:
fortunately for us!  To find a piece of civil rights history...inside a uniquely transformed restaurant...was such a find!! The food was remarkably fresh and so well prepared...impressive!
Emma was delightful...with a beautiful smile and sweet Southern Charm....offering excellent customer service while adding sight seeing hints!

owner_response.author: Selena K, Owner at Five & Dine Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: So glad that you found us and that you enjoyed your visit!  We appreciate you sharing your experience so that others may follow in your steps!  There is so much to see and do in Rock Hill - we hope to see you again soon as you explore more!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Brunch was Delicious!!!!!
data.text: This place is hidden jem in downtown Rock Hill !!!!!!!  The food is amazingly delicious and the prices are super affordable.

data.title: An Upscale Diner in the heart of Rock Hill
data.text:
We have loved our dinners at the Five and Dine. My husband and I first came upon it on Valentine's night. What a great meal we had! My husband had their Chicken and Waffles and I had the Shrimp and Grits. Both were very good. Our waitress was fun and informative.
We came back for my husband's birthday and had a great time with our family. He again had the Chicken and Waffles and this time I had the Smothered Chicken! It was delicious! Everyone at the table loved their meals and it was a great atmosphere for a family celebration. I will be back!

data.title: Event savers and amazing place to dine
data.text: Was in need of a place to have a last minute rehearsal party due to Hurricane Matthew and the Five-N-Dine came to the rescue. Selena was able to meet our food and beverage requirements along with a special dessert for the event. The food, staff and atmosphere were excellent. Original event was planned for Charleston, but having it here turned out to be even better. Memories to last a lifetime.

data.title: Not worth the stop
data.text: This use to be The Bistro. Great place, great service and great food. Now it's called the Five & Dine. Nice place, poor service and food that's not worth the price. My advice would be to eat at some other place that appreciates its customers.

owner_response.author: Selena K, Owner at Five & Dine Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Wow, Ken, sorry that you feel that way.  We do appreciate our guests very much.  Reviews like this have brought to our attention that we have some service issues.  We are working to address the situation and make a stronger management presence.

Thank you for taking the time though, to tell us about your experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hidden treasure
data.text: We stopped in for a late breakfast on a Friday.   Several folks there.  I had the French toast with bacon and my husband had an omelet.  We shared an order of breakfast potatoes.   Service was excellent.  Food did not take long and was piping hot.  French toast had wonderful cinnamon flavor, bacon was crispy.  The omelet was huge, fluffy and full of meat and cheese.  Prices very reasonable.  Great casual dining.

data.title: Good food in Rock Hil
data.text: If we are near downtown Rock Hill and we are looking for good food in a comfortable, friendly atmosphere, we head to the Five & Dine restaurant. They offer a nice selection of dishes, all of which are freshly prepared (and many of the ingredients are locally sourced). The kitchen can be pretty creative, and there always seems to be at least one dish on the menu that is unique (and delicious!).

data.title: great food
data.text: Great little diner on main street. I had a lobster pot pie that was amazing.  Very charming atmosphere. Staff was wonderful. I loved the hand made sodas.

data.title: Well...it was a pretty nice experience.
data.text:
My husband and I chose a quiet time to come visit this most talked about little corner of Rock Hill engulfed in history - we didn't know what to expect, so we didn't have any preconceived notions, but we were intrigued to try.

The place was empty because the lunch rush had just concluded. We were greeted and told we could have our choice of tables. The atmosphere has retained a taste of it's origins as a nod to it's poignant history, but the predominant feel is cozy, not fussy, with a lean towards casual eclectic. It was a comfortable vibe. And despite the lunch rush having been concluded, the restaurant was very clean.

Our wait person was extremely friendly and explained that they had just catered a major event and they were a bit harried, so an "in advance" apology was given, but as we came to learn, was not needed at all.

I ordered the Country Fried Chicken and my husband ordered the Angus Beef hamburger. This burger was found on the dinner menu, but the chef was accommodating and said that ordering it for lunch would be fine.

My order came with mashed potatoes which they were out of, so fries were substituted.  I had sweet tea and my husband just water.

We did not have to wait long for our food at all.  Our food was hot and I have to say, at first blush, the chicken had the feel of being "chicken fingers", but with the added peppered country gravy...oh dear, I was addicted!! Very tasty!! The chicken was crispy and not a trace of "grease" could be found.  I so wish I could have had the mashed potatoes to go with that amazing gravy. The fries were...fries...but fries are a hard food item to get correct from kitchen to table so...no worries. My dinner came with plain steamed broccoli, I love broccoli but this order was a little too crisp for my taste. The sweet tea did the southern tradition proud. An aside - I did have a small salad with my meal and ordered the balsamic vinaigrette - dressing was a bit too "tangy/sour" for me, but, that's just me. 

My husband's burger was cooked perfectly and he devoured every morsel. He was pleased, needless to say.

Our wait person was attentive and like I said very friendly, engaging us in conversation. We wanted for nothing.

Over all we had a very pleasant meal in a welcoming environment and I would say that it's well worth the trip to this small gem with a big history tucked away in beautiful downtown Rock Hill, SC.

data.title: Historical Landmark with Great Food
data.text: We wanted to just grab a quick sandwich but were amazed by the number of mouthwatering choices on the menu! We opted to order from the dinner menu. My husband ordered "Chicken and Waffles." I ordered the "Pulled Pork" platter. The salads that came with the dinners were pretty disappointing. The greens were obviously from a bagged mix, and had pieces of romaine that had started to brown. There were bits of tomato and chopped cucumber sprinkled on top. The only options for dressing were ranch and balsamic vinegar. I was surprised they would choose to make a first impression with a salad like that. My disappointment quickly turned to awe when out dinners came out. Check out the pictures of our plates. Huge portions, crisp waffles, juicy chicken and tangy pork. Really, really good Southern eats. This is a family restaurant. Twenty or so craft beer offerings. Wine available. There are also places at the counter that customers can sit. In addition to food they also serve old fashioned egg creams, floats, and phosphates. The historical significance of the place alone justifies a stop for drinks, coffee or dessert.

data.title: Food took over an hour
data.text: We went the Five & Dine on restaurant week on a Thursday evening. We had a reservation for 6:30 pm. We arrived a couple of minutes early and were seated immediately. There we not many people in the restaurant when we arrived and thought we might get good service. The waiter took our entire order and brought our drinks to us. We then got our appetizers. After over an hour waiting for our entrees we were able to get the attention of a waitress as our waiter seemed to avoid our area. We told her we had been waiting for over an hour and she asked if we were waiting for our desert and we told her we were waiting for our entrees. She went and talked to our waiter and there was a flurry of activity and finally another waiter stopped by and said that our waiter hadn't sent our order to the kitchen. We finally received our order. The food was very good but the delay was unacceptable. We were told that the chef had slipped in the kitchen and hit his head so the owner was back in the kitchen cooking. We were told we could have a free drink while we waited. We asked for the same wine we had ordered when we came in and after a while our waiter came back and said they were all out of that one so we had to find another one. We kept hearing the wait staff telling other tables that they were out of things and that they were sorry. The Five & Dine didn't seem to be ready for restaurant week, or as a restaurant really, as they were out of several things people were asking for. I am sorry that there was an accident in the kitchen but not sending orders back to the kitchen is not very professional. As I said earlier the food was very good when we finally got it but the entire experience was disappointing at best. I will go back one more time to try the food again but if I hear the wait staff say they are out of something I won't return again. I got tired of hearing "we are out of that" and 'I'm sorry". I don't understand a restaurant running out of alcoholic beverages as that is a money maker for food service establishments. One more chance Five & Dive and that's it. You need to step it up.

owner_response.author: Selena K, Owner at Five & Dine Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I appreciate your frank and honest review!  I am sorry that this was your experience but I am actually pleased to have this as a potential way to communicate with you.  You could have walked out and never looked back but you see the situation for what it is and are willing to give us another chance.  For that I am thankful. Charlotte Restaurant Week, for the most part, was amazing at Five & Dine.  In all honesty, there were 2 nights when diners did not experience us at our best.  That Thursday you dined with us was one of them.  You have heard enough excuses so I will not continue with them.  Instead, I invite you back to enjoy us as you should.  Feel free to ask for me, as I would like to meet you, but I promise you will not need me to intervene to receive wonderful food AND service!  We look forward to seeing you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good experience during Restaurant Week
data.text: Our experience was different and positive but we did eat early--with an elderly man so it was for his convenience. Serving were generous and food was excellent. They even included wine or beer in Restaurant Week offerings. Bigger variety than most other area restaurants for that week. Have had lunch there several times and it is always very good.  Give them another chance--and try the pimento cheese fritters.

data.title: Nice Cozy spot
data.text: First time visit was nice. Place has a cozy atmosphere. I had the Spinach and Mushroom Omelette which was tasty and coffee, my wife had the Banana Foster Pancakes and those were amazing.

data.title: The Good, the Bad, and the Tough
data.text:
Went there for lunch, along with a group of thirty or so 'Ladies who Lunch Loudly'.  Service was very nice, but a little slow given there were two servers.  I guess no one called ahead(?)
I ordered the Rueben with Sweet Potato chips.  My partner got the Crabcake burger and the Sweet Potato chips.
The corned beef is listed on the menu as 'house cured', which would explain the overabundance of allspice or cloves - no biggie if I were able to actually CHEW the meat.  Wow! Glad I had my fillings checked at the Dentist recently.
Can't treat a brisket like a pork sholder guys! Gotta cook it a long time and slice AGAINST the grain.
That's what i get for straying beyond the standard "Southern Flavor Palette" (Salt, Pork, Sweet, Fried).

Fortunately, my partner's Crabcake burger and the chips were extremely good.

We will return to try the other menu items, there's a lot to choose from, and, as I said earlier, very friendly service.

data.title: No food
data.text: I had the same issue that the other reviewer had. During restaurant week, we sat for 1 1/2 hours with just a cup of coffee. Never saw the food. I wasn't going to bother writing a review, because there was no food to review and I was craving chicken & waffles.After reading the response given to the previous reviewer, I was infuriated. Busy during restaurant week?????? What a surprise. That's what restaurant week is for. They have enough notice of the dates and should have been prepared. I take full advantage of restaurant week and have never seen a restaurant so completely unprepared. For this reason, I wouldn't consider going back. For the record my son is an executive chef and has worked restaurant week in a few cities. He ended up making chicken and waffles for me. It satisfied my craving so now I don't have to decide if I would try going back.

data.title: Great eggs cold grits
data.text: Great atmosphere for Sunday brunch. Had traditional breakfast free range eggs, grits, toast. Being Southern we are very particular about our grits. Most importantly they should be served piping hot! These were a bit lukewarm. Otherwise it was pretty good.

data.title: Food might be great - but I never found out
data.text: Reserved a table here because of their history and it being restaurant week. Originally had an 8:30 reservation but arrived much earlier. I found it strange that everywhere on line they indicate that they close at 8PM, which I'm wondering is why we left without ever receiving food. Received our drinks, and one hour and 15 minutes later we were wondering why the appetizer hadn't arrived, or any mention from the server that there was a problem. I then hear her walking over to another table and stating "it will be out in a moment". I looked around and realized most of the other tables was also waiting for food, which meant we had no clue how long it would take for us to get our food, or if we ever did receive it, half of it would have been cold and/or limp. We were so much looking forward to trying their chicken and waffles. An hour and a half later, we paid for our drinks and left a tip as we didn't know if it would have come out of the waitress' pocket. Thoroughly disappointed because of whatever problem the kitchen had, as well as the way the staff was able to handle the problem.

owner_response.author: Selena K, Owner at Five & Dine Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Sorry to hear that you didn't get to enjoy the meals that you came for.  Restaurant week was tremendous for us.  We had many first time guests and lots of regulars also who came to try our new menu items.  Feedback was so positive that we have decided to keep many of the restaurant week menu features on the daily dinner menu.

That being said, we had two dinner services that left diners wanting due to unforeseen circumstances in the kitchen.  It sounds like you visited on one of the unfortunate evenings.  I do sincerely hope that you find the opportunity to join us again and try our legendary Chicken & Waffles.  You will not be disappointed.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food ok, not great
data.text: Thought it would be better as owner also runs Fish Market, but disappointing as brunch selections not that good and quality of food average.

owner_response.author: Selena K, Owner at Five & Dine Restaurant, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Linda, 
Sorry to hear that you didn't feel that the brunch selections were adequate.  We try to provide a great variety on the brunch menu.  From fluffy egg omelets to chicken & waffles, sandwiches to shrimp & grits.  Hopefully you will try again and enjoy the quality of food we offer.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Darling Diner with Tasty Food
data.text: We enjoyed this little diner/restaurant in downtown Rock Hill. The pimento fritters were tasty as an appetizer. The lobster pot pie and sauteed scallops were delicious as entrees. The presentation was well done... we were looking at all the tables around us as food was delivered.

data.title: First Time Great Time
data.text: This was our first visit to Five and Dine, no doubt we will be back.  We were seated and had no wait for a table.  We were greeted and drink order taken within seconds of sitting down.  Our server was friendly and informative.  The pimento cheese fritters were huge and paired with red pepper jam-delicious!  The lobster pot pie had big chunks of lobster and was very tasty!  The scallops were really good and the peanut butter pie was over the top!  I really enjoyed the cheesecake for dessert.  Overall it was an excellent meal and we will definitely be back!
